Job Summary:

T3i is a special operations-centric organization deeply invested in USSOCOM and its components to develop, sustain, and advance the unique capabilities of SOF. By investing in our people through professional development, profit sharing, and equity ownership, T3i maintains a 95% retention rate company-wide enabling an impressive growth record. Our simple philosophy of putting the mission first, our people next, and our company last, has significantly contributed to the success and sustainability of our customers and their missions. The Business Development Manager (BDM) will be part of a close-knit team with a successful track record and still in the early stages of building a world-class organization.

T3i empowers its employees to be successful. Many of T3i’s greatest successes have been the result of empowered, passionate leaders. As a member of the business development team, the BDM will be a key member of our team and able to leverage his or her experience, skills and passion to advance our mission. The BDM will be collaborating with all the company stakeholders as he or she supports our strategic objectives.

The BDM will report to the Director of Business Development (BD). The BDM will be responsible for generating new business leads, shaping opportunities through the acquisition cycle, and leading capture efforts through the proposal phase. The ideal candidate will have well-rounded military and special operations service, and defense industry experience, along with excellent skills in task organization, recruiting, interviewing, proposal management, technical writing, and program management.

The BDM participates in strategy planning, development, and execution to include market and competitor analysis; opportunity identification and shaping; threat identification and mitigation; competitive assessment/intelligence analysis; execution of the Business Acquisition Process (BAP), and value proposition development.

The BDM develops exceptional customer intimacy through regular contact with the target communities, coordinates and supports senior-level customer engagements, develops and implements customer engagement strategies, and supports industry conferences and trade show activities.

The successful candidate will travel 25 to 50 percent of the time between to support BD requirements.

The preferred home base location for the BDM is Tampa, FL, Fayetteville, NC, or Virginia.

This is a full-time, exempt position in which the work is performed under limited supervision by executive management and is evaluated based on technical performance and awarded contracts.

Responsibilities:
• Serve as BDM for multi-million dollar business pursuits and other efforts with a team of experts
• Prepare for and present opportunity information during BD meetings and planning sessions
• Develop customer engagement and opportunity capture plans for current and future objectives
• Interact effectively (verbal and written) with customers, senior leadership, and staff
• Support the development of professional and competitive proposals
• Serve on proposal teams as required to maximize contributions to enable successful pursuits
• Manage BD shared drives, folders, and data to ensure efficient execution
• Provide expertise in analyzing, assessing, and recommending actions on proposal opportunities
• Support the development of themes, strategies, teaming, and execution strategies
• Assist with the collection of lessons learned and incorporation into SOPs and other processes

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
• Understanding of U.S. Federal Government procurement system
• Ability to work well in a team environment
• Strong attention to detail
• Excellent writing and grammar skills
• Excellent time management and ability to meet deadlines
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
• Ability to work independently and prioritize workload demands
• Ability to multi-task and work under tight time frames, including occasional nights and weekends

Required Skills and Experience:
• 20 years of career experience; including 4 years of BD experience
• Extensive personal and professional relationships with relevant customer base
• Proven experience developing and sustaining customer relationships
• Thorough understanding of federal procurement regulations for FAR/DFAR
• Current or ability to obtain and maintain a USG Top-Secret Security clearance

Desired Skills and Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, English, Communications, or related field
• Extensive experience winning defense industry contracts
• Extensive knowledge of relevant customers’ current support and or technical gaps
• Top Secret security clearance preferred

Type of Employment: Full-Time

T3i Drug Free Workplace Statement: As a Federal Government Contractor, T3i is required to strictly adhere to federally mandated drug-free workplace standards. To ensure compliance with this requirement, T3i conducts pre-employment drug screening for all new hire personnel (full time, part time, and independent contractor) and annual random drug screening for all current T3i personnel. All drug screening includes testing for the following drugs, at a minimum: Marijuana (CBD, hemp oil, and other cannabidiol use may result in a positive result), cocaine, amphetamines, opiates, 6-monoacetylmorphine, and PCP. Personnel who cannot pass drug screening are not eligible for employment with T3i.
